title: Get video data of a TikTok account

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Access token authorized by TikTok creators. To obtain an access token, use /tt_user/oauth2/token/ .

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: Application specific unique identifier for the TikTok account. Pass the value of the open_id field returned in the response of /tt_user/oauth2/token/ to this field.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Requested fields. If not set, returns the default field only. Default value : ["item_id"] . If you want to request multiple fields, you need to at least include "item_id" in the value for fields . Otherwise, an error may occur. Example : ["item_id", "create_time"] . Note : All video engagement metrics are aggregated over the lifetime of the video. Unlike profile-level metrics, the aggregation is not limited to a 60-day look-back period. To retrieve certain fields in the response, you must have specific permissions. You can check the "Required permission" column for each field in the response schema to determine the permissions needed. To confirm that you have the necessary permission scope, you can check the scope returned by the /tt_user/token_info/get/ endpoint. If the required permission has not been granted to you, follow the steps outlined in Authorization to enable the TikTok account user to reauthorize your app with the permission. Supported fields : item_id : Unique identifier for the video. thumbnail_url : Preview thumbnail URL for the video. share_url : A shareable URL for the video. embed_url : An embeddable URL for the video. caption : The caption/description for the video. video_duration : Duration of the video, in seconds. likes : Likes. The total number of likes the video has received. comments : Comments. The total number of comments the video has received. shares : Shares. The total number of times the video has been shared. favorites : Favorites. The total number of times the video has been added to favorites. create_time : Unix/epoch date-time when the video was posted. reach : Reach. The number of people who watched your published content at least once. video_views : Video views. The number of times viewers watched your video. Note : Counts when playback duration >0 and the playback is the first playback in an impression session. If the user swipes away from the ad then swipes back, it would be counted as 2 impressions. Therefore, a new video view will be counted again with the new impression session. total_time_watched : Total play time. The amount of time viewers spent watching your video. average_time_watched : Average watch time. The average time viewers spent watching your video. full_video_watched_rate : Watched full video rate. The percentage of viewers who finish watching your video. new_followers : New followers. The number of viewers who started following you. profile_views : Profile views. The total number of profile views from users who visited through your video. website_clicks : Website clicks. The total number of clicks on your website link from users who visited your profile page through your video. phone_number_clicks : Phone number clicks. The total number of clicks on your phone number link from users who visited your profile page through your video. lead_submissions : Lead submissions. The total number of leads (e.g. price quotes, newsletter subscriptions, etc.) collected from your consumers who visited your profile page through your video. app_download_clicks : App download link clicks. The total number of clicks on your app download link from users who visited your profile page through your video. email_clicks : Email clicks. The total number of times people have clicked the Email button on your profile after watching this specific video. address_clicks : Address clicks. The total number of times people have clicked the Address button on your profile after watching this specific video. video_view_retention : Audience retention. This metric indicates how many of your viewers are still watching after a certain amount of time. impression_sources : Traffic source. This metric helps you understand the breakdown of traffic sources for those who viewed your video. audience_genders : Gender. The distribution of your viewers by gender. This data is based on factors including the information viewers provide. audience_countries : Top countries. The distribution of your viewers by the top countries or regions. This data is based on factors including the information viewers provide. audience_cities : Top cities. The distribution of your viewers by the top cities. This data is based on factors including the information viewers provide. audience_types : Viewer types. The breakdown of your audience into new viewers versus returning viewers, and followers versus non-followers. engagement_likes : Engagement likes. The distribution of your viewers who liked your video at specific points in the video's timeline.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Filters to apply to the result set.

parameters.name: video_ids
parameters.description: A list of video IDs to filter the insights for. Example : ["6995316737801538821", "8015388216995316737"] .

parameters.name: ad_post_only
parameters.description: Valid only when video_ids is specified. Whether to filter videos ( video_ids ) to include only those that have been used as Spark Ads. Supported values: true , false . Default value: false .

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. If the response parameter has_more is true, pass the returned cursor in this parameter in the subsequent request to receive the next page of results. Default value : Current time as Epoch/Unix timestamp in milliseconds. Note : The cursor value is a UTC Unix timestamp in milliseconds. You can pass in a customized timestamp to fetch the user's videos posted before the provided timestamp.

parameters.name: max_count
parameters.description: The maximum number of videos that will be returned for each page. Default value : 10 Maximum value : 20 Note : Due to our trust and safety policies, it is possible that the endpoint returns less than max_count number of videos even if the response parameter has_more is true.
